text: The JAC Refine M5 is a light commercial Van made by JAC Motors since 2002. It is the first-ever vehicle from the JAC Refine series. == First Generation (2002-2015) == The first generation JAC Refine M5 launched in 2002 and was a rebadged Hyundai Starex. This was mainly due to a joint venture between Hyundai and JAC with JAC making the Hyundai Starex under license. It was initially called JAC Refine but it was later changed to JAC Refine M5 as a vehicle of the JAC Refine series. It has a 2.0-liter (both turbo and standard) or 2.4-liter petrol engine, or a 2.8-liter diesel engine. It has a 5-speed manual transmission or a 4-speed automatic transmission which was later improved. == Second Generation (2011-present) == The second generation Refine M5 was initially shown as a concept called the JAC Refine IV at the Beijing Auto Show in 2010. The production version was later launched at the Shanghai Auto Show in 2011. After the establishment of the JAC Refine series, the JAC Refine was renamed to the JAC Refine M5 and is currently positioned between the JAC Refine M4 and the JAC Refine M6. It now has a 1.8 or 2.0-liter turbo petrol engine or a 1.8 or 1.9 liter turbo diesel engine. It has a 6-speed manual and DCT transmission, or a 5-speed automatic transmission. == Markets == The JAC Refine M5 is mainly sold in the Chinese market. == References == Category:Chinese automobiles Category:Minibuses Category:2000s automobiles Category:2010s automobiles Category:2020s automobiles Category:Vans
title: JAC Refine M5
